background: A bakery uses a stand-mixer and a slow bake oven to make bread and cookies.
constraints: Total mixer hours for bread and cookies cannot exceed MaxHours
Total oven hours for bread and cookies cannot exceed MaxHours
Number of loaves of bread is non-negative
Number of batches of cookies is non-negative
objective: Maximize the total profit from bread and cookies
description: A bakery uses a stand-mixer and a slow bake oven to make bread and cookies. Each machine can run for at most \var{MaxHours} hours per year. To bake a loaf of bread takes \var{BreadMixerHours} hour in the stand mixer and \var{BreadOvenHours} hours in the oven. A batch of cookies requires \var{CookieMixerHours} hours in the mixer and \var{CookieOvenHours} hour in the oven. The profit per loaf of bread is \var{ProfitBread} and the profit per batch of cookies is \var{ProfitCookies}. How should the bakery operate to maximize total profit?

parameters.definition: Maximum operational hours per year for the stand-mixer and the oven
Hours taken in the stand mixer to make a loaf of bread
Hours taken in the oven to bake a loaf of bread
Hours taken in the stand mixer to make a batch of cookies
Hours taken in the oven to bake a batch of cookies
